courseSectionInformation: Same as ESE 106. This course can be used to fulfill either Western or Nonwestern general education categories, but not both.
description: A survey of major world regions by systematically considering five themes: environment, population and settlement patterns, cultural coherence and diversity, geopolitical fragmentation and unity, and economic and social development. While examining the persistence of unique regions, the course will both scale up to global linkages and scale down to place-specific impacts of globalization processes. Same as ESE 106. This course can be used to fulfill either Western or Nonwestern general education categories, but not both.
label: Geographies of Globalization
sectionDegreeAttributes: Non-Western Cultures, Social Sciences, and Western Compartv Cult course.
